title: What time does the Logan Paul KSI press conference start?
text:
Logan Paul and KSI are set to face the crowds in London ahead of their rematch (Picture: Getty Images)

The boxing rematch we’ve all been waiting for is almost here, as Logan Paul and KSI prepare to go head-to-head in the ring once again next month.

The YouTubers confirmed last month they would face one another again – and now they’re holding another press conference, except this time it’s in London.

The pair clearly won’t be short of things to tell the British press, given how the pair have already exchanged words on social media, with KSI telling Logan: ‘Try not to cry off the stage this time,’ ahead of the social media star’s trip to these shores.

But just what time is the press conference, where’s it taking place – and how can you tune in?

Here’s what you need to know…

What time does the Logan Paul KSI press conference start?

Advertisement

Advertisement

The press conference is due to get underway at 6pm London time.

You can tune in to the press conference online (Picture: DAZN)

The previous press conference between the pair of them in LA saw them hurling bizarre insults at each other, with Logan telling KSI he ‘smelt like herpes’, KSI telling Logan that his breath smelt and plenty of other banter.

We can’t wait to see what they say to one another in London.

Where is the press conference taking place?

The pair will be meeting the press at the Troxy in East London.

How can you watch the press conference?

Last year’s fight ended in a majority draw (Picture: Kit Oates/REX)

Sadly it’s not going to be screened on any TV channel – but that doesn’t mean you can’t tune in online.

As well as sports streaming service DAZN, it’ll be streamed live on both Logan Paul and KSI’s YouTube channels.

So you definitely don’t need to miss out.

When is the rematch between KSI and Logan Paul?

The rematch is due to take place at the Staples Center in Los Angeles on Saturday 9 November.

The first match ended in a majority draw following six rounds of sparring – in an evening which also saw Logan’s brother Jake Paul go head to head with KSI’s brother Deji.

At the time Logan called for a rematch, saying: ‘I think it’s what the people want. Let’s give them a motherf*****g rematch!’

Advertisement

Advertisement

KSI was in agreement as he declared: ‘Let’s do that again, that was fun. Holy shit.’

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

description: The Logan Paul KSI rematch press conference is set to take place later today - but when is it and can you tune in online?
